item.title: [Delta] Highly improved stairs system. || Updated
item.dc:creator: @Clawz_fury lare69
item.description:
@Clawz_fury wrote:

great job, looks like you put a lot of effort into this, will definitely reference this when creating my own.

ps: be sure to use a try-catch statement in your for-loops, just in case of a ArrayIndexOutOfBounds exception, so instead of disconnecting the player, it will print an error and move on.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Highly improved stairs system. || Updated
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“izak ruud, post:31, topic:440447”]RandQm why even make a tutorial and post at the bottom

For any problems or questions leave a reply.

If you don’t even want to help them?

And when someone asks a legit question, or has a legit problem you just blandly tell them what to do, but dont explain it? I am new to this stuff and I wish you would help me just a tad more. When I asked you to look at my client.java you said No, I will not do it for you. But you didn’t say anything else helpful at all. And to be honest it would probably take you less time to just take a quick peek then to type all those comments.[/quote]

I did, told you what the problem was and how to solve it.

First of all make sure you putted it in the right packet. Second, check on top of your packets how your identicater for the objectid is written. Maybe its without capital or something.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Highly improved stairs system. || Updated
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

[quote=“izak ruud, post:31, topic:440447”]RandQm why even make a tutorial and post at the bottom

For any problems or questions leave a reply.

If you don’t even want to help them?

And when someone asks a legit question, or has a legit problem you just blandly tell them what to do, but dont explain it? I am new to this stuff and I wish you would help me just a tad more. When I asked you to look at my client.java you said No, I will not do it for you. But you didn’t say anything else helpful at all. And to be honest it would probably take you less time to just take a quick peek then to type all those comments.[/quote]

This isn’t a spoon feeding community. He shouldn’t have to walk step by step, and explain every little bit. People should use logic, and find out on their own about some things. It’s called not being lazy.

Read full topic

item.title: [Delta] Highly improved stairs system. || Updated
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“izak ruud, post:20, topic:440447”]Please help I get this error:

[quote]client.java:13497: error: variable objectID might not have been initialized
if (objectID == stair) {

client.java:13593: error: variable objectID might not have been initialized
if (objectID == stair) {
2 errors
Press any key to continue…[/quote]

I did everything in this tutorial right & I did the optional stuff. Please tell me how to fix. I assume its simple but I’m new at this stuff. Thanks for the tut btw easy to follow, only I got 2 errors xD[/quote]

First of all make sure you putted it in the right packet.
Second, check on top of your packets how your identicater for the objectid is written.
Maybe its without capital or something.

client.java:13593: error: variable objectID might not have been initialized
if (objectID == stair) {
2 errors
Press any key to continue…

I did everything in this tutorial right & I did the optional stuff. Please tell me how to fix. I assume its simple but I’m new at this stuff. Thanks for the tut btw easy to follow, only I got 2 errors xD

item.description:

[quote=“neroxx, post:16, topic:440447”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=543130.msg3984011#msg3984011 date=1335648263]

[quote author=neroxx link=topic=543130.msg3983901#msg3983901 date=1335640979]

When I search for: packet 132 it says it cant find it…

:fp:
search for “case 132”

if you search for “void parseincomingpackets” you’ll see there’s a switch used.
Where the packets are located in as cases.
[/quote]Umm… It cant find case 132 either…

It would really surprise me if you have a delta without the object action packet.
[/quote] I use the blank delta source you released for a very short time ago…[/quote]

then it’s in packets.java
